results.title: The Kind hearted ant
results.creator_credit: Aleksandar Marks, Vladimir Jutrisa and Zagreb Film
results.brief_description: In an anthill of five million ants, there is always one ant out of step. Based on a Yugoslavian children’s song, this animated film tells the story of an ant who unintentionally disrupts the harmony and order of the ant-hill. A sardonic survey of insect behaviour, charming and genuinely funny using a striking yet simple visual style.

results.title: The Killing of Angel Street
results.brief_description: Jessica Simmonds returns home from London and is shocked to find the street she grew up in being torn apart to make way for a high rise development. She sympathises with the plight of the local residents, who are being forced out of their homes by the brutal tactics of the developers. Probing into the background of Angel street development, she unearths a sinister connection between organised crime, the developer, the police and the highest levels of government.

results.title: The Koala. - Rev ed.
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film looks at the biological characteristics of the koala and the various types which are determined by its climatic region in Eastern Australia. Those features which make the koala peculiarly adaptable to its territorial environment are described and its life cycle is surveyed. A shorter, revised version of T/Code 005919.

results.title: The Karate Kid (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John G. Avildsen, Jerry Weintraub and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Daniel, a fatherless teenager, arrives in Los Angeles from the East Coast and faces the difficult task of making new friends. He becomes the object of bullying by a menacing gang of karate students, the Cobras, when he strikes up a relationship with the leader’s ex-girlfriend, Ali. Daniel’s handyman, Miyagi, a master of martial arts, teaches him karate and that fighting is always a last answer to a problem. Daniel learns that karate is a mastery over the self, mind and body, and develops physical skills as well as faith and self confidence.

results.title: The Just, the bad and the ugly
results.creator_credit: Bruce Currie, Australian Film Commission and Currie
results.brief_description: A compilation of 4 of Bruce Currie’s dark and surrealistic experimental animations: Flank Breeder (7 mins), Anatomy of a Businessman (7 mins), One Potato Moor (6 mins) and Tar Baby (9 mins). Using the same crew and musicians (Even Orchestra), Currie digresses into dark and pessimistic urban vignettes that are anchored in base emotion: Flank Breeder shows a trapped mailbox living in the city too consumed with his tedious routine to be able to extract himself from his home to save an injured animal outside his door. Anatomy of a Businessman internalises the office politics and disillusionment. One Potato Moor finds a scarecrow (Bruce Currie) lamenting his miserable life whilst fending off a menacing pig (Paul Livingston aka Flacco) in order to survive. Life is really ugly when two men compete bitterly for the attentions of a woman in Tar Baby.

results.title: The Kangaroos
results.creator_credit: David Moore and Peter Du Cane
results.brief_description: An amazingly diverse group of marsupials, the kangaroos range from small hare-wallabies and curious tree dwelling kangaroos in the Queensland rainforests, to the great Red, Euro and Grey Kangaroos of the plains, hills and forests. The behaviour of these and other kangaroos is the subject of this program.

results.title: The Joycelin Shrager story
results.creator_credit: Barton Weiss, Mark Block and Kino Delux
results.brief_description: The filmed biography of Joycelin Shrager, a mythical, appallingly incompetent woman director, whose obsession with film pervades her whole existence.

results.title: The Koala brothers
results.creator_credit: Tobias Fouracre, Famous Flying Films and Spellbound
results.brief_description: Set in outback Australia, two aeroplane-pilot koala brothers set out to help anyone in need. Other Australian animal friends are also involved in their adventures. “The Koala Brothers” is a puppet-style animated television series suitable for children aged 2 to 6 years old. This DVD contains six episodes approximately 10 minutes each. Narrated by Jonathon ‘Jono’ Coleman.

results.title: The Joy of winter
results.creator_credit: Bernard Gosselin, Jean Dansereau, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: How Canadians adjust to their long, snowbound season. Filmed with humour, The Joy of Winter shows people making the best of what they cannot change. From tiny tots to human polar bears the film leaves no doubt that, in the eyes of many Canadians, winter may offer more attractions than summer. Film without words. (Awards: Gijon; Necochea.)
